text.section: There is a Joint Committee on Transparency and Open Government.

section.section:
Of the 12 members:
6 shall be members of the Senate of Maryland, appointed by the President of the Senate; and
6 shall be members of the House of Delegates, appointed by the Speaker of the House.

text.section: From among the membership of the Committee, the President of the Senate shall appoint a Senator to serve as the Senate Chair of the Committee, and the Speaker of the House shall appoint a Delegate to serve as the House Chair of the Committee.
The Department of Legislative Services shall provide staff assistance to the Committee.

The purposes of the Committee are to:
provide continuing legislative oversight regarding transparency and open government; and
make recommendations regarding initiatives that will increase citizen access to government resources, publications, and actions.

The Committee shall hold:
an organizational meeting promptly after the appointment of its members; and
any other meetings that the Committee considers necessary to carry out its duties efficiently.

The Committee may:
hold a hearing on any matter relating to the functions of the Committee; and
consider a vote on a bill or resolution referred to it by the President or the Speaker.

section.section: Subject to § 2-1246 of this title, the Committee shall submit a report to the General Assembly on or before December 1 each year.

The report shall include:
a description of the work of the Committee; and
any recommendations of the Committee.
